bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, June 16, 1941

div1.p: Kean writes that he regrets his treatment of Kissinger. Ireland gave him a good report of the address by Hench.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, June 16, 1941

opener.dateline:
2804 N STREET, N. W.
GEORGETOWN
WASHINGTON, D. C.
June 16th. 41

div1.p:
Yours of the 11th is just received
and my conscience reproaches me
for my failure to have been more
charitable in my judgment of
poor Kissinger, by comparison with
your generosity- I am thankful that
you acquit me of having been one
of those who spoke of him “slight-
ingly”, but my own conscience does
not do so, but tells me that it
is another evidence of your char-
ity, of spirit- I am sorry that
his end has come, or is at hand
and am glad that he knew you before
it came- General Ireland came to
2
see me yesterday and gave me
a very pleasing account of the
luncheon and of your address
which he thought admirable-

I think I wrote you how enthusiastic
Mrs. Blossom Reed was about the whole
affair and the attentions shown her-
She is Dr. Walter Reed only daughter and
was the apple of his eye- She made
an unfortunate marriage, after his
death, with a Dr. Cook- (no relation of
the one in the y. f. episode) and after
getting a divorce resumed her mai-
den name-

Mrs. Kean and I are both much
pleased at your desire to have
the “contract”- My son will not
want it I think, He will be
sufficiently loaded up with souvenirs
3
when I die, as I have little else
to leave him. As you would like
it as is, I will have to follow
your suggestion about getting the
Express Co to crate it as well as
transport it, tho. I do not like
to put the additional expense
on you P. S. I called up the express
Co. & they said that they did not
prepare packages for shipment &
only received packages all ready-
So there I called in consultation
my colored boy James who pro-
duced the crate in which Mr.
Kellogg sent me the Osler picture-
It was too small but he & I took
it apart and stretched it and
I think has made a good job
AC
K
4
which will carry the “Contract”
safely to Rochester Minn-

And my very hearty admiration
for the work that you have done
and are doing, goes with it.
